cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 425 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest today, then turning north-north-east on Friday toward the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cameron to Morgan City, Louisiana

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of the mouth of the Pearl River to Bay St. Louis, MS (tropical-storm watch area).
weather_observation.warning_coast: San Luis Pass, TX to Sabine Pass and east of Morgan City, LA to the mouth of the Pearl River, including New Orleans, Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas (tropical-storm warning); East of Sabine Pass to Morgan City, LA (hurricane warning); Sabine Pass to Ocean Springs, MS (storm-surge warning).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Louisiana coastline, especially from Sabine Pass eastward to Ocean Springs, MS, with greatest impacts between Cameron and Port Fourchon.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are likely Friday with a small chance of brief hurricane-force gusts if the core tracks just west of the river.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–6 ft possible from Port Fourchon to the mouth of the Mississippi River; 2–4 ft in Lake Pontchartrain/Maurepas and along the lower Mississippi River near the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches expected with locally up to 15 inches, producing flash and urban flooding as well as minor river rises along the Mississippi.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Friday–Friday night; dangerous seas and strong currents in the lower river approaches hindering vessel navigation.
